Mr. Cooper, (by permission of A. BUNN, E S Q . ) Gratiano, Mr. Vining, Launcelot, Mr. Webster,
Antonio, Mr. Haines, Portia, Mrs. Faucit, Nerissa, Mrs. Nisbett, Jessica, Miss Turpin, with
MARRIED LIFE, and olher Entertainments,—being for the Benefit of Mr. W. Farren.
On Monday, The HYPOCRITE; Doctor Cantwcll, Mr. W. Farren, Maw-worm, Mr. Webster, Col.
Lambert, Mr. Vining, Darnly, Mr. Brindal, Sir John Lambert, Mr. Strickland, Old Lady Lambert.
Mrs .Glover, Young Lady Lambert, Mrs. Ashton, Charlotte, Mrs. Nisbett, with MARRIED LIFE,
and {never acted at this Theatre) the Melo-dramatic Romance of The MAGPIE; Or, The Maid
of Palaiseau; Gervas, Mr. Strickland, Richard, Mr. Brindal, Blaisot, Mr. Buckstone, Bailli, Mr.
Webster, Isaac, Mr. Haines, Annette, Mrs. Nisbett, Dame Gervas, Mrs. Tayleure.
On Tuesday, The QUEEN'S CHAMPION, with MARRIED LIFE, and other Entertainments.
On Wednesday, the Tragedy of HAMLET; Hamlet, Mr. Butler, {late of the Theatre Royal, Covent
Garden) Gertrude, Mrs. Glover, with MARRIED LIFE.
OnThursday, {not acted these Nine Years) the Comedy of TEAZING MADE EASY ; Litigant, Mr.
Strickland, Glow-worm, Mr. Vining, Gammon, Mr. Webster, Peter Pastoral, Mr. Buckstone, Mrs.
Teazer, Mrs. Tayleure, Mrs. Crompton, Mrs. W. Cliflord, Mias Crompton, Miss E. Phillips, Molly
Mixem, Mrs. Humby, Miss Manly, Mrs. Nisbett, with MARRIED LIFE, and The QUEEN'S
CHAMPION.
On Friday, The QUEEN'S CHAMPION, with MARRIED LIFE, and other Entertainments.

*f* In consequence of the cordial and universal approbation with "which Mr.
W. F A R R E N was honored in his attempt of the character of S H Y L O C K , he will
repeat it T O - M O R R O W , being the Last Night of his Engagement.
To-Morrow, The MERCHANT OF VENICE ; Shylock, (on this occasion) Mr. W. Farren, Bassanio,
Mr. Brindal, Gratiano, Mr. Vining, Launcelot, Mr. Webster, Antonio, Mr. Haines, Portia, Mrs,
Faucit, Nerissa, Mrs. Nisbett, Jessica, Miss Turpin, with MARRIED LIFE.—In the course of
the Evening, Mr. W. Farren will sing (in character) "The Old English Gentleman."
On Wednesday, the Tragedy of HAMLET; Hamlet, Mr. Butler, (late of the Theatre Royal, Corent
Garden) Gertrude, Mrs. Glover, with MARRIED LIFE.
OnThursday, (not acted these Nine Years) the Comedy of TE AZING MADE EASY ; Litigant, Mr.
Strickland, Glow-worm, Mr. Vining, Gammon. Mr. Webstefv Peter Pastoral, Mr. Buckstone, Mr*.
Teazer, Mrs.Tayleure, Mrs. Crompton, Mrs. W. Clifford, Miss Crompton, Miss E. Phillips, M>[{y
Mixem, Mrs. Humor, Miss Manly, Mrs. Nisbett, with MARRIED LIFE, and The QUEEN'S
CHAMPION.

A grand Pas de Deux by M. EMILE PETIT and Madlle. STEPHAN.
A grand Pas de Deux by M. MASSOT and Madlle. VIRGINIE STEPHAN.
A SWISS RONDE by all the Principal Dancers.
ACharacteristic Pas Senl by Madlle. VIRGINIE STEPHAN.
An Allemande and Waltz by Master ALBERT, Miss ROSE, and Miss BULLEN.
The Ballet to finish with a general Waltz and Tableau.
Stage-Manager. Mr S. T. RUSSELL. 1
